paper_abstract: It was proved recently that a super-simple orthogonal array (SSOA) of strength and index is equivalent to a minimum detecting array (DTA). In computer software tests in component-based systems, such a DTA can be used to generate test suites that are capable of locating -way interaction faults and detect whether there are more than interaction faults. It is proved in this paper that an SSOA of strength , index and degree , or an SSOA, exists if and only if excepting possibly a handful of cases.
